newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Bunds eye downside to 101.42/43.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Bunds eye downside to 101.42/43.

text.p: September Bund futures traded on LIFFE will ignore oversold indicators and continue to probe the downside towards 101.42/43, technical analysts said Wednesday.
That level was the 50 percent retracement of the rally from a low of 99.32 on May 5 to the contract high of 103.52 set on July 23.
"Although it's oversold, there is still downside potential," said a broker at a European bank in London. "I'd ideally like to see it hold the 50 percent retracement if it's going to bounce."
September Bund futures were down eight basis points at 101.63 by 0705 GMT.
The 101.42/43 level was also reinforced by two daily lows at 101.43 set on June 30 and July 1.
"It's quite a strong level," the broker said. "It's got a good chance of holding."
He said there had been initial support from congestion around the 101.59/60 level, but that was wiped out in early trade. The next support before the main level was the psychological 101.50.
David Sneddon, technical analyst at Credit Suisse First Boston in London said he pegged support in a band from 101.48 down to 101.42.

"Not only is the 50 percent retracement in there, but also the 38.2 percent of the move from the 98.19 low in April to the contract high," he said. "There's also a late June reaction low and a (support) line on the weekly continuation chart."
He said Bunds were likely to hold that level, as they had already exceeded the measured target of 101.74 from the top put in place last week.
"I'd buy on dips unless it breaks below 101.38, which will mean that band has been broken," said Sneddon.
A break of 101.38 would target 101.18, he said.
On the upside, resistance was at the 101.85 reaction high.
Above there, the broker at the European bank said the 102.02 level, which had been a strong support on the way down, would now act as heavy resistance.
The next target would be 102.63, the July 25 low formed between the peaks of the double top.
At the short end, December Euromarks were down one basis point at 96.39.
